title: aggregate
text: Load package: like use synthetic data run examples, can create save current working directory code : , already data saved current working directory, load :
code: library(rapidcycler) generate_synthetic_data(pop_size = 1000000) patient_data <- data.table::fread("patient_data.csv") vaccination_data <- data.table::fread("vaccination_data.csv") outcome_data <- data.table::fread("outcome_data.csv")

title: aggregate
text: 7 required inputs function, several optional inputs revert default specified. code create new folder current working directory, given getwd(). must also ‘options.txt’ file saved location.
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment aggregate_data(patient_data, vaccination_data, outcome_data,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3)

title: aggregate
text: two important file locations within function: options_file_location: ‘options.txt’ file stored (local memory) working_directory: new folder created, within aggregated tables saved inputs default current working directory, given getwd(), specified. use different location, can either change current working directory using setwd() (locations ), use inputs specify different locations (need match, recommended folder structure ).
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment aggregate_data(patient_data, vaccination_data, outcome_data,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3,                options_file_location = "~/Documents/RCA_COVID/",                working_directory = "~/Documents/RCA_COVID/")

title: aggregate
text: find running RAM execution aggregate_data() function, execution slow, can restrict amount data aggregated one time using split_size input. function splits input data portions size split_size according PID, stores split datasets subfolder called ‘data’, aggregates one split time, recombines performs final aggregation splits complete. default 500,000, lowered memory issue. large amounts RAM, increasing split size may also speed aggregation. NOTE: still input whole datasets - function handle splitting .
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment aggregate_data(patient_data, vaccination_data, outcome_data,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3,                 split_size = 100000)

title: aggregate
text: NOTE: use method input datasets large possible load R one go. , can divide data chunks aggregating. , must specify input_data_in_chunks = TRUE. data divided chunks PID, records associated person included chunk. temporary results chunk stored last chunk aggregated (specified using final_chunk = TRUE), temporary results combined final aggregation performed. case, need call aggregate_data() function multiple times. time, pass single chunk dataset, therefore, requires loading new chunk input data (either saved file directly database) function call. example assumes input datasets split 2 chunks, exists code retrieve chunks saved file directly database. IMPORTANT - combine fully aggregated tables together, produce correctly aggregated tables. Dealing input data chunks must performed way described
code: patient_data_chunk1 <- load_patient_data_chunk1() vaccination_data_chunk1 <- load_vaccination_data_chunk1 outcome_data_chunk1 <- load_outcome_data_chunk1  aggregate_data(patient_data_chunk1, vaccination_data_chunk1, outcome_data_chunk1,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3,                 input_data_in_chunks = TRUE,                final_chunk = FALSE) # FALSE until final chunk  # Remove data from memory (can also do this automatically by setting 'restore_input_data = FALSE' in function call) rm("patient_data_chunk1", "vaccination_data_chunk1", "outcome_data_chunk1")  patient_data_chunk2 <- load_patient_data_chunk2() vaccination_data_chunk2 <- load_vaccination_data_chunk2 outcome_data_chunk2 <- load_outcome_data_chunk2  aggregate_data(patient_data_chunk2, vaccination_data_chunk2, outcome_data_chunk2,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3,                 input_data_in_chunks = TRUE,                final_chunk = TRUE) # TRUE to trigger final aggregation  # Remove data from memory (can also do this automatically by setting 'restore_input_data = FALSE' in function call) rm("patient_data_chunk2", "vaccination_data_chunk2", "outcome_data_chunk2")

title: aggregate
text: possible stop aggregation restart later time. can stop aggregation manually interrupting execution, using stop_after_n_splits input. Either way, aggregation can resumed stopped. Note , stop aggregation manually interrupting execution, input datasets restored global environment afterwards. However, saved ‘data’ subfolder (split format) ready resumption, can restored global environment using recombine_input_data() function. example stop aggregation 2 splits input datasets aggregated (note, aggregate splits across time periods study designs). simplest way resume aggregation using resume_cycle_aggregation() function:
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment aggregate_data(patient_data, vaccination_data, outcome_data,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3,                 stop_after_n_splits = 2) resume_cycle_aggregation(folder_name = "RCA_COVID_TEST_SITE_20220101-20220131",                           working_directory = "~/Documents/RCA_COVID/")  # NOTE: also optional arguments stop_after_n_splits, input_data_in_chunks, and final_chunk, that behave in the same way as previously described

title: validate
text: Load package: like use synthetic data run examples, can create save current working directory code : , already data saved current working directory, load :
code: library(rapidcycler) library(dplyr) library(magrittr) generate_synthetic_data(pop_size = 1000000) patient_data <- data.table::fread("patient_data.csv") vaccination_data <- data.table::fread("vaccination_data.csv") outcome_data <- data.table::fread("outcome_data.csv")

title: validate
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment validate_input_data(patient_data, vaccination_data, outcome_data,                     cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                     cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"))

title: validate
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment validate_input_data(patient_data %>% mutate(DOB = as.character(DOB)),                      vaccination_data %>% rename(VAC_DATE = V_DATE),                      outcome_data %>% mutate(AESI = if_else(AESI == "ADEM", "ADM", AESI)),                     cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                     cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"))

title: validate
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment validate_input_data(patient_data,                      vaccination_data = NULL,                      outcome_data,                     cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                     cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"))

title: Authors and Citation
text: Benjamin Atkins. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Atkins B (2024). rapidcycler: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) GVDN. R package version 1.0, https://atkinsbd.github.io/rapidcycler.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rapidcycler: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN},   author = {Benjamin Atkins},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0},   url = {https://atkinsbd.github.io/rapidcycler}, }

what: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: Read page website: https://atkinsbd.github.io/rapidcycler/ protocol, data dictionary, table templates, information suppport use package can found GVDN extranet: RCA II (2024) goal rapidcycler bring together number methodologies functions used perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA). current version package includes functionality validate aggregate line list data de-identified format sharing GVDN. also additional functionality produce synthetic line list data, though thoroughly tested used illustrative/testing purposes. Future versions include functions perform sequential analysis using maximised sequential probability ratio tests (MaxSPRT), visualise results, produce reports. Shiny app also planned aid regular communication results. Sites required use functions, analysis dissemination results performed GVDN, however provided transparency sites may utilise please.

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: can install rapidcycler two ways:

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: unable connect GitHub within working environment, method use. single zipped file (tarball) made available download () import environment. contain source code package, can opened checked, however edited. saved environment, package can installed following command: update package, process downloading, importing, installing tarball must repeated. NOTE: working Windows machine, need Rtools installed order build package source file. can downloaded installed : https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/
code: # EDIT THE FILE PATH AND NAME AS NECESSARY install.packages("~/Documents/rapidcycler_1.0.0.0.tar.gz", repos = NULL, type="source")

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: able connect GitHub within working environment, method offers streamlined way install update package. need access GitHub repository use method, set personal access token SSH key (see https://happygitwithr.com/https-pat info).
code: devtools::install_github("Global-Vaccine-Data-Network/rapidcycler", build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: several R packages need installed installing rapidcycler: clock data.table dplyr fst magrittr rlang stringr

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: package installed, can loaded used way R package. two main ways : Load whole package functions using library(rapidcycler). can call functions name, e.g. aggregate_data(). Use specific functions :: notation, e.g. rapidcycler::aggregate_data(). functions can access using methods called exported functions, primary functions interact . However, also many non-exported, internal functions, lot work behind scenes. functions also documented (see ‘Reference’ tab website, help page RStudio), can accessed using ::: notation. example, rapidcycler:::convert_date_to_number(date), convert Date object 8-digit integer representation date. necessary explore explicitly use functions, wish .

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: package split 6 main parts, separate purpose: Aggregate: aggregate line list data appropriate, de-identified format sharing Validate: validate input datasets performing aggregation Generate: generate synthetic input data testing illustrative purposes Configure (expected future version) Analyse (expected future version) Visualise (expected future version)

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: participate RCA, sites required interact aggregation part package. functionalities used GVDN perform analyses report results, however provided sites make use wish (expected future version). depth explanation aggregation functions examples, refer aggregate vignette: can found ‘Articles’ tab website, running vignette("aggregate", "rapidcycler") RStudio (package installed).

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: starting point interacting package obtain 3 data.table objects, containing information patients, vaccinations, AESI outcomes. full data dictionary can found : RCA II (2024), summary input dataset structures given : patient_data Contains patient details. Patients must cohort least part current cycle - , birth entry cohort cycle end, death exit cohort cycle start. vaccination_data Contains vaccination details individuals patient_data. Vaccinations must occurred start study period (cycle) end current cycle. outcome_data Contains AESI outcome details individuals patient_data. Outcomes must occurred start lookback period (cycle) end current cycle. Unless otherwise specified, lookback period covers 2 years prior study start date.

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: restriction folder structure use within local environment. However, case useful, provide outline structure recommend . Folder names can changed please, note name folder created aggregate_data() function changed (details aggregate vignette).
code: GVDN │ └───RCA2     │     └───COVID   <------- working directory     |   │   options.txt     |   |        |   └───RCA_COVID_TEST_SITE_20250101-20250131   <------- zip and send to GVDN     |   |   │   data_self_pre.csv     |   |   │   data_self_post.csv     |   |   │   data_exposed_person_days.csv     |   |   │   data_exposed_cases.csv     |   |   │   data_descriptive_vaccination.csv     |   |   │   data_descriptive_outcomes.csv     |   |   │   data_concurrent_vac.csv     |   |   │   data_concurrent_unvac.csv     |   |   │   notes.txt     |   |        |   └───RCA_COVID_TEST_SITE_20250201-20250228   <------- zip and send to GVDN     |   |   │   data_self_pre.csv     |   |   │...     |   |        |   |...     |     (in the future...)     |     └───RSV (or other future module)         │   options.txt         |            └───RCA_RSV_TEST_SITE_20260101-20260131         |   │   data_self_pre.csv         |   |...         |...

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: explanations examples relating functionalities within package, please see included vignettes. can browse vignettes using browseVignettes("rapidcycler") RStudio, ‘Articles’ tab website.

title: Aggregate line list datasets — aggregate_data
text: function take input datasets create folder containing aggregated tables separate csv files, depending participation level. separate folder created cycle period. Aggregation can stopped resumed (see resume_cycle_aggregation() function). trigger historical data aggregation (.e. vaccinations began), set vaccination_data = NULL. Requires 'options.txt' file run - sent GVDN. Validation input datasets automatically run part function, throw error finds issues require fixing. like run validation separately, use validate_input_data() function.

title: Aggregate line list datasets — aggregate_data
code: aggregate_data(   patient_data,   vaccination_data,   outcome_data,   cycle_start_date,   cycle_end_date,   site_code,   participation_level,   design_selection = NULL,   options_file_location = getwd(),   options = NULL,   suppression_limit = NULL,   split_size = 5e+05,   stop_after_n_splits = NULL,   restore_input_data = TRUE,   working_directory = getwd(),   input_data_in_chunks = FALSE,   final_chunk = FALSE,   skip_user_prompts = FALSE )

title: Aggregate line list datasets — aggregate_data
text: patient_data Patient data input data.table vaccination_data Vaccination data input data.table. Set NULL perform historical data aggregation outcome_data AESI outcome data input data.table cycle_start_date Start date cycle, date object, 8 digit number form yyyymmdd, string form yyyy-mm-dd cycle_end_date End date cycle, date object, 8 digit number form yyyymmdd, string form yyyy-mm-dd site_code Site code (e.g. AUS_MCRI), string participation_level Site's level participation, number 1-3: 1 = minimal, 2 = partial, 3 = full design_selection Character vector specific study designs run, needed wish run study designs within level participation. Default NULL, run study designs according level participation options_file_location Location options.txt file stored. Supply either options_file_location options, . Defaults getwd() options Options object, already converted txt file. Supply either options_file_location options, suppression_limit required, low numbers can suppressed. Numbers less limit suppressed, except 0 split_size Input data automatically split pieces size (default 500,000). memory issue, lower split_size. Aggregation done split data separately, combined splits complete. Aggregation can stopped restarted last completed split (see resume_cycle_aggregation() function) stop_after_n_splits Use stop aggregation given number splits. Aggregation can resumed later date (see resume_cycle_aggregation() function) restore_input_data TRUE (default) input data restored data folder global environment aggregation complete, stop_after_n_splits reached. FALSE, input data restored. WARNING: data folder removed aggregation complete (stopped using stop_after_n_splits) working_directory Location working directory. folder cycle created. Defaults getwd(). input_data_in_chunks Option pre-split input data. use data large load R one go (otherwise just use split_size) final_chunk pre-split input data, use indicate running last chunk input data. trigger function combine temporary results end skip_user_prompts Boolean allowing user prompts skipped, mainly purpose testing prompts possible. Recommended leave FALSE.

what: Aggregate data with concurrent comparators — aggregate_data_concurrent
title: Aggregate data with concurrent comparators — aggregate_data_concurrent
text: Aggregate risk/control AESI counts ratio according concurrent study designs, within given period time.

title: Aggregate data with concurrent comparators — aggregate_data_concurrent
code: aggregate_data_concurrent(   patient_data,   vaccination_data,   outcome_data,   period_start,   period_end,   options,   comparator = "vaccinated",   allow_side_effects = FALSE,   analysis_types = NULL,   return_preaggregated = FALSE )

title: Aggregate data with concurrent comparators — aggregate_data_concurrent
text: patient_data Patient data input data.table vaccination_data Vaccination data input data.table. Set NULL perform historical data aggregation outcome_data AESI outcome data input data.table period_start Start date period, date object. Period lengths defined options file, cycle possibly containing multiple periods. single period aggregated time. period_end End date period, date object. Period lengths defined options file, cycle possibly containing multiple periods. single period aggregated time. options Options object, already converted txt file. Supply either options_file_location options, comparator Specify whether 'vaccinated' 'unvaccinated' comparator group used allow_side_effects Whether changes made original input data allowed persist function completed. analysis_types Character vector defining primary sub-analyses included study (options file) return_preaggregated Due calculation ratios assignment controls, two fully aggregated tables can combined study design. TRUE, function combine risk/control groups calculate ratio, instead return objects separately list. allows majority aggregation performed stages, combining calculating ratio end (using concurrent_final_aggregation() function)

title: Aggregate data with concurrent comparators — aggregate_data_concurrent
text: return_preaggregated = FALSE, returns data.table object matching 'Concurrent - Vac' 'Concurrent - Unvac' templates. return_preaggregated = TRUE, returns list four data.table objects corresponding control/risk counts control/risk groups, required produce final table.

code: create_notes_file(   cycle_start_date,   cycle_end_date,   site_code,   participation_level,   options,   stored_parameters,   save_location )

title: Create notes file — create_notes_file
text: cycle_start_date Start date cycle, date object, 8 digit number form yyyymmdd, string form yyyy-mm-dd cycle_end_date End date cycle, date object, 8 digit number form yyyymmdd, string form yyyy-mm-dd site_code Site code (e.g. AUS_MCRI), string participation_level Site's level participation, number 1-3: 1 = minimal, 2 = partial, 3 = full options Options object, already converted txt file stored_parameters list parameters used aggregation, saved temporarily whilst aggregation ongoing save_location Location save created txt file

what: Generate synthetic AESI outcome data — generate_outcome_data
title: Generate synthetic AESI outcome data — generate_outcome_data
text: Generates synthetic AESI outcome data people contained patient_data vaccinations given vaccination_data. uses vaccination data specified RR appropriately adjust outcome rates exposed periods. person, amount time spent risk (exposed) periods unexposed periods calculated. , number AESI outcomes experienced person drawn poisson distribution, total exposed non-exposed periods independently, rate parameter scaled RR exposed cases. Finally, cases occur uniform randomly assigned date relevant period (exposed cases exposed period time, non-exposed cases non-exposed period time), encounter type randomly assigned 1-4.

title: Generate synthetic AESI outcome data — generate_outcome_data
code: generate_outcome_data(   patient_data,   vaccination_data,   study_start_date = as.Date("2021/01/01"),   study_end_date = as.Date("2024/01/01"),   outcomes = c("ADEM", "MYO", "ST"),   outcome_daily_rates = rep(1e-06, length(outcomes)),   RR = 5,   risk_window = 42 )

title: Generate synthetic AESI outcome data — generate_outcome_data
text: patient_data Patient data input data.table (date columns Date objects, 8-digit number format) vaccination_data Vaccination data input data.table (date columns Date objects, 8-digit number format) study_start_date Date object defining start study study_end_date Date object defining start end study outcomes Character vector options AESI codes. outcome_daily_rates Numeric vector daily outcome rates, length order outcomes vector. RR Numeric value vector defining increased risk due vaccination. vector, must length order outcomes. risk_window Length risk window post-vaccination. Currently accepts single number (outcomes), risk window assumed start day vaccination.

title: Generate synthetic AESI outcome data — generate_outcome_data
text: data.table matching AESI data template (date columns date objects, 8-digit number format)

title: Generate synthetic patient data — generate_patient_data
text: Generates cohort size pop_size, dates birth sampled uniform randomly two specified dates (default 100 years study start study end). Age death based beta distribution specified parameters, defines date death. Anyone dies study start removed, whole process repeated pop_size reached.

title: Generate synthetic patient data — generate_patient_data
code: generate_patient_data(   pop_size = 1e+06,   study_start_date = as.Date("2021/01/01"),   study_end_date = as.Date("2024/01/01"),   dob_start_date = study_start_date - 100 * 365.25,   dob_end_date = study_end_date,   death_age_beta1 = 10,   death_age_beta2 = 2,   death_age_max = 100,   sexes = c("m", "f") )

title: Generate synthetic patient data — generate_patient_data
text: pop_size Number people population study_start_date Date object defining start study study_end_date Date object defining start end study dob_start_date Date object defining earliest possible date birth cohort (defaults 100 years start study) dob_end_date Date object defining latest possible date birth cohort (defaults study end date) death_age_beta1 Shape parameter 1 beta distribution age death death_age_beta2 Shape parameter 2 beta distribution age death death_age_max Maximum age death sexes Options biological sex birth (drawn uniformly)

title: Generate synthetic patient data — generate_patient_data
text: data.table matching patient data template, pop_size rows (date columns date objects, 8-digit number format)

title: Generate synthetic input datasets — generate_synthetic_data
text: function simplified wrapper around three complex functions generate synthetic patient, vaccination, AESI outcome data (see generate_patient_data(), generate_vaccination_data(), generate_outcome_data() respectively). Importantly, also converts date columns three datasets Date objects 8-digit number format required. greater control datasets produced, use 3 specific functions listed .

title: Generate synthetic input datasets — generate_synthetic_data
code: generate_synthetic_data(   pop_size = 1e+06,   study_start_date = as.Date("2021/01/01"),   study_end_date = as.Date("2024/01/01"),   save_data = TRUE,   save_location = getwd() )

title: Generate synthetic input datasets — generate_synthetic_data
text: pop_size Number people population (defines size patient_data) study_start_date Date object defining start vaccination campaign study study_end_date Date object defining end study save_data Boolean whether save data, well return (default TRUE, save) save_location Location save data, save_data = TRUE. Defaults current working directory

title: Generate synthetic input datasets — generate_synthetic_data
text: Named list containing 3 datasets: "patient_data", "vaccination_data", "outcome_data", matching respective templates.

title: Generate synthetic vaccination data — generate_vaccination_data
text: Generates vaccination data people contained patient_data. number vaccinations person receives drawn poisson distribution specified mean (can 0). number vaccinations drawn, vaccination dates brands uniform randomly sampled.

title: Generate synthetic vaccination data — generate_vaccination_data
code: generate_vaccination_data(   patient_data,   campaign_start_date = as.Date("2021/01/01"),   campaign_end_date = as.Date("2024/01/01"),   vaccine_codes = c("ABC", "DEF", "GHI"),   mean_doses = 3 )

title: Generate synthetic vaccination data — generate_vaccination_data
text: patient_data Patient data input data.table (date columns Date objects, 8-digit number format) campaign_start_date Date object defining start vaccination campaign (generally study start date) campaign_end_date Date object defining end vaccination campaign vaccine_codes Character vector options vaccine brand codes mean_doses Mean number doses per person campaign, parameter Poisson distribution

title: Generate synthetic vaccination data — generate_vaccination_data
text: data.table matching vaccination data template (date columns date objects, 8-digit number format)

what: rapidcycler: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN — rapidcycler-package

Set NULL skip dataset. vaccination_data_input_name Desired name vaccination_data object global environment, defaults "vaccination_data". Set NULL skip dataset. outcome_data_input_name Desired name outcome_data object global environment, defaults "outcome_data". Set NULL skip dataset.

title: Resume data aggregation — resume_cycle_aggregation
text: folder_name Name main results folder cycle (including path) working_directory Location main results folder cycle (path ), defaults getwd(). stop_after_n_splits Use stop aggregation given number splits. Aggregation can resumed later date (). input_data_in_chunks Option pre-split input data. use data large load R one go (otherwise just use split_size). match used initial call aggregate_data(). final_chunk pre-split input data, use indicate running last chunk input data. trigger function combine temporary results end. match used initial call aggregate_data().
